info.title: Entry API
info.description:
With UiTdatabank's Entry API you can create new events, places and organizers, and add extra info to them with specific requests to add/update properties. For example there are operations to add a label, remove a label, add an image, and so on.

## Postman

<!-- focus: false -->

[![Download postman collection](https://postman.publiq.be/postman-download.svg)](https://postman.publiq.be/?api=udb-entry)

Do you already have a **client id** and **client secret**?
Download a personalized Postman collection to start making requests in seconds!

id.description: The id of the created event.

eventId.description: The id of the created event (deprecated and replaced with `id`).

url.description: The url of the JSON-LD representation of the created event.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

post.description:
Creates a new event.

<!-- theme: warning -->

> This request is also supported with an older, deprecated schema that was used to create an event with just its required fields.

get.description: Returns the details of the event for the given `eventId`.

204.description: No Content. The event's `workflowStatus` was successfully updated to `DELETED`.

delete.description: Does a soft-delete of the event. The event will continue to exist but it's `workflowStatus` will be changed to `DELETED`. This will remove it from all publication channels.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

put.description:
Updates the event with the given `eventId` by completely overwriting it with the properties in the given JSON. 

<!-- theme: danger -->

> Any existing and optional properties on the event that are not included in the update request will be removed from the event.

<!-- theme: info -->

> Certain existing `labels` or `hiddenLabels` may be kept on the event even if they are not included in the update request. For example if they were added via the UiTdatabank UI, or if the client or user making the request does not have sufficient permission to remove specific labels.

requestBody.description: The details of the event to update.

description.description: A human-readable description of the update to the event. (Always in Dutch.)

date.description: The date and time that the update happened in an ISO-8601 format with a timezone offset. For example `2021-08-26T16:54:38+00:00`.

author.description: Identifier of the user who made the change. Should not be treated as a semantic user id though, because it can be an email, v1 user id, or v2 user id. Should only be displayed and used by admins that look at the history log to look up the user in the correct system.

api.description: Human-readable name of the API that was used to make the change. Not always present in older history logs.

auth0ClientId.description: The id of the Auth0 client that made the change. (If it was an Auth0 API client.)

auth0ClientName.description: Name of the client in Auth0 that made the change. (If it was an Auth0 API client.)

apiKey.description: API key of the UiTID v1 consumer that made the change (if it was an UiTID v1 consumer).

consumerName.description: Name of the UiTID v1 consumer that made the change (if it was an UiTID v1 consumer).

get.description:
Returns the history log of the event for the given `eventId`.

The history log is an array of objects that contain info about each individual update to the event, who did the update, using what API, etc.

Because this history log can contain API keys which are secret (deprecated but still usable for backward compatibility), it can only be accessed by users that are a "god user".

Because of this limitation, the endpoint is also documented as internal and not visible in the public docs.

204.description: No Content. The event's audience was successfully updated.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/uitdatabank/incompatible-audience-type

schemaErrors.error: The data (int) should match the type: string

put.description:
Updates the intended audience of the event, which currently only has one property `audienceType`. 

By default the audienceType is set to `everyone`. If needed the audience can be updated to `members` to hide it on public channels, or `education` for CultuurKuur events for schools.

204.description: No Content. The event's availableFrom was successfully updated.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

schemaErrors.error: The data (int) should match the type: date-time

put.description: Updates the availableFrom of the event. This is the first date & time that the event is allowed to be visible on publication channels.

204.description: No Content. The bookingAvailability has been updated successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/uitdatabank/calendar-type-not-supported

value.title: Calendar type not supported
value.detail: Not allowed to update booking availability on calendar type: "permanent". Only single and multiple calendar types can be updated.

put.description:
Updates the general bookingAvailability info on the top level of the event with the given `eventId`.

The bookingAvailability of any subEvents that the event has will also be updated to match the general bookingAvailability.

<!-- theme: warning -->

> Note that you cannot update the bookingAvailability of an event with [calendar type](/models/event-calendarType.json) `periodic` or `permanent`. For now, they can only have "Available" as bookingAvailability.

204.description: No Content. The calendar information has been updated successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

put.description:
Updates the calendar information of the given `eventId`. The calendar information will be completely replaced with the new one.

The required properties depend on the `calendarType` property.

| calendarType  | required  | optional  |
|---|---|---|
| single  | subEvent\[0\].startDate, subEvent\[0\].endDate | subEvent\[0\].status, subEvent\[0\].bookingAvailability  |
| multiple  | subEvent\[\*\].startDate, subEvent[\*\].endDate  | subEvent\[\*\].status, subEvent\[\*\].bookingAvailability  |
| periodic  | startDate, endDate  | openingHours, status, bookingAvailability  |
| permanent  |   | openingHours, status, bookingAvailability  |

<!-- theme: warning -->

> If `status` or `bookingAvailability` is missing on the event or a subEvent, it will default to `Available`.
>
> Although the status and bookingAvailability are optional they have a default value of `Available`. When the status and bookingAvailability is not provided an already set value will be overwritten to `Available`!

<!-- theme: success -->

> You can use `single` and `multiple` interchangeably as long as you also include `subEvent` as well. The API will use the correct type based on the number of subEvents inside `subEvent`.

<!-- theme: info -->

> This endpoint also supports a deprecated schema that uses `timeSpans` instead of `subEvent`. The `timeSpans` also have a slightly different structure than `subEvent`. For new integrations, it is recommended to use the schema with the `subEvent` property. 
> 
> For existing integrations the `timeSpans` property will be supported indefinitely for backward compatibility.

200.description: The calendar summary in either plain text or HTML. For example: ``` Van 6 januari 2021 tot 23 juni 2021 (geannuleerd) ``` Or: ``` Van 6 januari 2021 tot 23 juni 2021 (geannuleerd) ```

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/url/query-parameter-invalid

value.title: Query parameter invalid
value.detail: Query parameter "langCode" does not support value "es".

get.description:
Returns a human-readable summary of the calendar information of the event. Can be configured to return either plain text or HTML, and to switch between four different formats depending on the amount of space you have to display it.

> For backward compatibility this endpoint is also accessible at the old abbreviated `/events/{eventId}/calsum` path.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: Deprecated alternative to the `accept` header. Supported for backward compatibility.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Defines the size of the summary. Larger summaries contain more detail for events with multiple dates/hours but will also take up more space when shown in a UI. We recommend to use the format `md` for the search results (and `lg` for events with calendarType single), and to always use `lg` for the detailpage. In some cases (e.g. mobile apps) calendar summary `xs` can be useful.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Defines the language that the summary will be written in. Also influences the date/time format used.

parameters.name: hidePast
parameters.description: Will hide past dates in summaries of events with multiple dates. By default, past dates are not excluded from the calendar summary.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The timezone to format date/times in.

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: Indicates the expected content-type. Defaults to `text/plain` but can be set to `text/html` for a HTML response.

parameters.name: langCode
parameters.description: Deprecated alternative to the `language` query parameter. Supported for backward compatibility.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Deprecated alternative to the `size` query parameter. Supported for backward compatibility.

204.description: No Content. The facilities have been successfully updated.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

put.description:
Updates the list of available (accessibility) facilities on the event. These will show up in the [event's `terms`](/models/event-terms.json).

A list of possible facilities can be found using our [Terms guide](/docs/terms.md).

**Note**: A special permission is required to update an event's facilities in UiTdatabank, even if you are the event owner. Contact an administrator for further information.

204.description: No Content

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/url/path-parameter-invalid

value.title: Path parameter invalid
value.detail: Location with id "74e62b6c-9df4-42e4-bcd5-f4c242b4df2e" does not exist.

put.description:
Updates the event's location to a new place based on the given `eventId` and `placeId` in the URL.

If the `eventId` does not exist a `404 Not Found` response will be returned. If the `placeId` does not exist a `400 Bad Request` response will be returned. Otherwise a `204 No Content` will be returned if successful. (See response examples below.)

patch.description:
Updates the given subEvents on the event with the given `eventId`.

Allows partial updates, omitted properties will be ignored and remain unchanged. Omitted subEvents will also remain unchanged.

Every subEvent to update requires an `id` property that is an integer that corresponds to their index in the list of subEvents on the parent event. For example `0` for the first subEvent, `1` for the second subEvent, and so on.

<!-- theme: warning -->

> Note! If you change the `startDate` of a subEvent, the subEvents will be re-ordered on the parent event afterwards because subEvents are always sorted chronologically.

Only events with calendar type `single` and `multiple` have subEvents, so only events with those calendar types support this endpoint.

204.description: No Content. The subEvents have been updated successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/uitdatabank/calendar-type-not-supported

value.title: Calendar type not supported
value.detail: Not allowed to update subEvents on calendar type: "permanent". Only subEvents on single and multiple calendar types can be updated.

requestBody.description:
The subEvents to update, with the properties to update. 

Each subEvent must have an `id` property to indicate which subEvent should be updated. This `id` is the position of the subEvent in the list of subEvents on the parent event. For example `0` for the first subEvent, `1` for the second subEvent, and so on.

All other properties are optional, and only properties that are included will be updated. No subEvents or properties will be removed.

204.description: No Content

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/url/path-parameter-invalid

value.title: Path parameter invalid
value.detail: Term with id "1.2.1.0.0" can not be used as an event type.

put.description:
Updates the event's type (examples of types are `Concert`, `Opendeurdag`, `Lessenreeks`, and so on) based on the given `eventId` and `termId`.

Terms are pre-defined and can be found using our [Terms](/docs/terms.md) guide. Only terms from the `eventtype` domain can be used as event types.

If the `eventId` does not exist a `404 Not Found` will be returned. If the `termId` does not exist or is not a term in the `eventtype` domain, a `400 Bad Request` will be returned. If the request is successful a `204 No Content` will be returned.

204.description: No Content

delete.description:
Deletes the event's current theme based on the given `eventId`.

If the `eventId` does not exist a `404 Not Found` will be returned. If the request is successful a `204 No Content` will be returned.

204.description: No Content

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/url/path-parameter-invalid

value.title: Path parameter invalid
value.detail: Term with id "1.2.1.0.0" can not be used as a theme.

put.description:
Updates the event's theme (examples of themes are `Audiovisuele kunst`, `Moderne dans`, `Actie en avontuur`, and so on) based on the given `eventId` and `termId`.

Terms are pre-defined and can be found using our [Terms](/docs/terms.md) guide. Only terms from the `theme` domain can be used as theme.

If the `eventId` does not exist a `404 Not Found` will be returned. If the `termId` does not exist or is not a term in the `theme` domain, a `400 Bad Request` will be returned. If the request is successful a `204 No Content` will be returned.

200.description: The video was added to the event.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

schemaErrors.error: The required properties url is missing.

requestBody.description: The new video to add to an event.

post.description:
Add a video as a URL reference to an event

The video objects contains:

* `url`: The full URL of the video. Currently only *Vimeo* and *Youtube* are supported as video source locations.
* `copyrightHolder`: The copyright holder of the video material. Although this field is optional it is strongly recommended to add a reference to the entity owning the rights on the video material.

204.description: No Content. The videos are updated.

patch.description:
Update one or more videos of an event.

The video object(s) must contain

* `id`: The id of the video object to be changed.

The video object(s) can contain:

* `url`: The full URL of the video. Currently only *Vimeo* and *Youtube* are supported as video source locations.
* `language`: The updated language of a video
* `copyrightHolder`: The copyright holder of the video material. Although this field is optional it is strongly recommended to add a reference to the entity owning the rights on the video material.

requestBody.description: An array of videos to be changed.

delete.summary: Delete a video from an event

204.description: No Content. The video was deleted from the event.

delete.description: Delete an embedded video from an event based on the event id and the video id.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

requestBody.description: New calendar information for the event copy.

post.description:
Creates a new event based on all the properties of an existing event with the given `eventId`. Only the calendar information will be completely replaced with a new one, which has to be included in the request body.

The schema of the request body is the same as the one for the [`PUT /events/{eventId}/calendar`](/reference/entry.json/paths/~1events~1{eventId}~1calendar/put) endpoint.

put.description:
<!-- theme: danger -->

> The major-info endpoint is deprecated and should not be used in new integrations!

Updates the "major info" of the event with the given `eventId`.

The major info contains:

* `name`: The name of the event in the event's `mainLanguage`, as a string
* `type`: Id of the event's `eventtype` taxonomy `term`, as a string
* `theme` (optional): Id of the event's `theme` taxonomy `term`, as a string
* `location`: Object with the id of the event's location, as a place's uuid (string)
* `calendar`: Object with the event's calendar information (see schema below)

All properties are required (except for `theme`) and will overwrite existing values of these properties on the event. If the event has a `theme` `term` before this update, but there is no `theme` in this major-info update, the `theme` will be removed.

<!-- theme: success -->
> For backward-compatibility with older integrations, this operation can also be requested via `POST /event/{eventId}/major-info`.

204.description: No Content. The major-info has been updated successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

id.description: The id of the created place.

placeId.description: The id of the created place (deprecated and replaced with `id`).

url.description: The url of the JSON-LD representation of the created place.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

post.description:
Creates a new place.

<!-- theme: warning -->

> This request is also supported with an older, deprecated schema that was used to create a place with just its required fields.

get.description: Returns the details of the place for the given `placeId`.

204.description: No Content. The place's `workflowStatus` was successfully updated to `DELETED`.

delete.description: Does a soft-delete of the place. The place will continue to exist but it's `workflowStatus` will be changed to `DELETED`. This will remove it from all publication channels.

id.description: The id of the updated place.

placeId.description: The id of the updated place (deprecated and replaced with `id`).

url.description: The url of the JSON-LD representation of the updated place.

commandId.description: The command id of the import job.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

put.description:
Updates the place with the given `placeId` by completely overwriting it with the properties in the given JSON. 

<!-- theme: danger -->

> Any existing and optional properties on the place that are not included in the update request will be removed from the place.

<!-- theme: info -->

> Certain existing `labels` or `hiddenLabels` may be kept on the place even if they are not included in the update request. For example if they were added via the UiTdatabank UI, or if the client or user making the request does not have sufficient permission to remove specific labels.

requestBody.description: The details of the place to update.

204.description: No Content. The place availableFrom was successfully updated.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

description.description: A human-readable description of the update to the place. (Always in Dutch.)

date.description: The date and time that the update happened in an ISO-8601 format with a timezone offset. For example `2021-08-26T16:54:38+00:00`.

author.description: Identifier of the user who made the change. Should not be treated as a semantic user id though, because it can be an email, v1 user id, or v2 user id. Should only be displayed and used by admins that look at the history log to look up the user in the correct system.

api.description: Human-readable name of the API that was used to make the change. Not always present in older history logs.

auth0ClientId.description: The id of the Auth0 client that made the change. (If it was an Auth0 API client.)

consumerName.description: Name of the UiTID v1 consumer that made the change (if it was an UiTID v1 consumer).

get.description:
Returns the history log of the place for the given `placeId`.

The history log is an array of objects that contain info about each individual update to the place, who did the update, using what API, etc.

Because this history log can contain API keys which are secret (deprecated but still usable for backward compatibility), it can only be accessed by users that are a "god user".

Because of this limitation, the endpoint is also documented as internal and not visible in the public docs.

204.description: No Content. The calendar information has been updated successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

put.description:
Updates the calendar information of the given `placeId`. The calendar information will be completely replaced with the new one.

The required properties depend on the `calendarType` property.

| calendarType  | required  | optional  |
|---|---|---|
| periodic  | startDate, endDate  | openingHours, status, bookingAvailability  |
| permanent  |   | openingHours, status, bookingAvailability  |

<!-- theme: warning -->

> If the event has a `status` or `bookingAvailability` that is not `Available`, and you do not include this `status` or `bookingAvailability` in the new calendar information, they will get reverted back to the default `Available`!

<!-- theme: danger -->

> Contrary to events, places cannot use calendarType `single` or `multiple`!

200.description: The calendar summary in either plain text or HTML. For example: ``` Van 6 januari 2021 tot 23 juni 2021 (geannuleerd) ``` Or: ``` Van 6 januari 2021 tot 23 juni 2021 (geannuleerd) ```

> For backward compatibility this endpoint is also accessible at the old abbreviated `/places/{placeId}/calsum` path.

We recommend to use the format `md` for the search results (and `lg` for events with calendarType single), and to always use `lg` for the detailpage. In some cases (e.g. mobile apps) calendar summary `xs` can be useful

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Defines the language that the summary will be written in. Also influences the date/time format used.

parameters.name: hidePast
parameters.description: Will hide past dates in summaries of events with multiple dates. By default, past dates are not excluded from the calendar summary.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The timezone to format date/times in.

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: Indicates the expected content-type. Defaults to `text/plain` but can be set to `text/html` for a HTML response.

parameters.name: langCode
parameters.description: Deprecated alternative to the `language` query parameter. Supported for backward compatibility.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Deprecated alternative to the `size` query parameter. Supported for backward compatibility.

204.description: No Content. The facilities have been successfully updated.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

put.description:
Updates the list of available (accessibility) facilities on the place. These will show up in the [place's `terms`](/models/place-terms.json).

A list of possible facilities can be found using our [Terms guide](/docs/terms.md).

**Note**: A special permission is required to update an place's facilities in UiTdatabank, even if you are the place owner. Contact an administrator for further information.

204.description: No Content

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/url/path-parameter-invalid

value.title: Path parameter invalid
value.detail: Term with id "1.2.1.0.0" can not be used as a place type.

put.description:
Updates the place's type (examples of types are `Bioscoop`, `Monument`, `Theater`, and so on) based on the given `placeId` and `termId`.

Terms are pre-defined and can be found using our [Terms](/docs/terms.md) guide. Only terms from the `eventtype` domain can be used as place types.

If the `placeId` does not exist a `404 Not Found` will be returned. If the `termId` does not exist or is not a term in the `eventtype` domain, a `400 Bad Request` will be returned. If the request is successful a `204 No Content` will be returned.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

schemaErrors.error: The required properties url is missing.

requestBody.description: The new video to add to a place.

post.description:
Add a video as a URL reference to place

The video objects contains:

* `url`: The full URL of the video. Currently only *Vimeo* and *Youtube* are supported as video source locations.
* `copyrightHolder`: The copyright holder of the video material. Although this field is optional it is strongly recommended to add a reference to the entity owning the rights on the video material.

204.description: No Content. The videos are updated.

patch.description:
Update one or more videos of a place.

The video object(s) must contain

* `id`: The id of the video object to be changed.

The video object(s) can contain:

* `url`: The full URL of the video. Currently only *Vimeo* and *Youtube* are supported as video source locations.
* `language`: The updated language of a video
* `copyrightHolder`: The copyright holder of the video material. Although this field is optional it is strongly recommended to add a reference to the entity owning the rights on the video material.

requestBody.description: An array of videos to be changed.

delete.summary: Delete a video from a place

204.description: No Content. The video was deleted from the place.

delete.description: Delete an embedded video from an place based on the place id and the video id.

put.description:
<!-- theme: danger -->

> The major-info endpoint is deprecated and should not be used in new integrations!

Updates the "major info" of the event with the given `placeId`.

The major info contains:

* `name`: The name of the place in the place's `mainLanguage`, as a string
* `type`: Id of the place's `eventtype` taxonomy `term`, as a string
* `theme` (optional): Id of the place's `theme` taxonomy `term`, as a string
* `address`: Object with the address of the place (see schema below)
* `calendar`: Object with the place's calendar information (see schema below)

All properties are required (except for `theme`) and will overwrite existing values of these properties on the place. If the place has a `theme` `term` before this update, but there is no `theme` in this major-info update, the `theme` will be removed.

<!-- theme: success -->
> For backward-compatibility with older integrations, this operation can also be requested via `POST /place/{placeId}/major-info`

204.description: No Content. The major-info has been updated successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

post.description:
Creates a new organizer.

<!-- theme: info -->

> Organizers are required to have a unique `url` value to avoid accidental duplicate organizers.

<!-- theme: warning -->

> This request is also supported with an older, deprecated schema that was used to create an organizer with just its required fields.

201.description: The organizer has been created successfully.

id.description: The id of newly created organizer.

organizerId.description: The id of newly created organizer. (Deprecated in favor of `id`.)

url.description: The url of the JSON-LD data of the newly created organizer.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/uitdatabank/duplicate-url

delete.description:
<!-- theme: info !-->
> Note: only users with the permissions `Organisaties beheren` can delete an organizer.

Delete the organizer with the given `organizerId`.

204.description: No Content. The organizer was deleted successfully.

get.description: Returns an the organizer with the given `organizerId`

200.description: The organizer has been updated successfully.

id.description: The id of the updated organizer.

organizerId.description: The id of the updated organizer. (Deprecated in favor of `id`.)

url.description: The url of the JSON-LD data of the updated organizer.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/uitdatabank/duplicate-url

put.description:
Updates the organizer with the given `organizerId` by completely overwriting it with the properties in the given JSON. 

<!-- theme: danger -->

> Any existing (optional) properties on the organizer that are not included in the update request will be removed from the organizer.

<!-- theme: info -->

> Certain existing `labels` or `hiddenLabels` may be kept on the organizer even if they are not included in the update request. For example if they were added via the UiTdatabank UI, or if the client or user making the request does not have sufficient permission to remove specific labels.

Updates the contact point information of the organizer with the given `organizerId`. A contact point has a list of the following properties:
* Url: an array of valid urls
* Email: an array of valid emails
* Phone: an array of phone numbers

All properties are optional.

204.description: No Content. The organizer contact point has been updated successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

put.description: Updates the url of the organizer with the given `organizerId`. The provided url can not be in use on another organizer.

204.description: No Content. The organizer url has been updated successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/uitdatabank/duplicate-url

put.description:
Adds the given label to the organizer with the given `organizerId`.

If the specified label does not exist yet in UiTdatabank a new label will be created with default visibility and public permissions (usable by anyone), and linked to the organizer.

The label must be longer than 1 character and shorter than 255 characters. The label can also not contain the semicolon character. It should match the regex `^(?=.{2,255}$)(?=.*\S.*\S.*)[^;]*$`

204.description: No Content. The label has been added successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/url/path-parameter-invalid

value.title: Path parameter invalid
value.detail: The provided label name is not valid.

delete.description:
Deletes the given label from the organizer with the given `organizerId`.

The label must be longer than 1 character and shorter than 255 characters. The label can also not contain the semicolon character. It should match the regex `^(?=.{2,255}$)(?=.*\S.*\S.*)[^;]*$`

204.description: No Content. The label has been deleted from the organizer successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/url/path-parameter-invalid

value.title: Path parameter invalid
value.detail: The provided label name is not valid.

put.description: Updates the description of the organizer with the given `organizerId`. The new description of the request body will be set on the organizer in the given `language`. The new description needs to be at least one character long.

204.description: No Content. The organizer description has been updated successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/url/path-parameter-invalid
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

value.description: This organizer is responsible for creating cultural events for schools around Brussels.

204.description: No Content. The description was deleted.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/url/path-parameter-invalid

delete.description: Deletes the description in the given `language` from the organizer with the given `organizerId`.

put.description: Updates the name of the organizer with the given `organizerId`. The new name of the request body will be set on the organizer in the given `language`. The new name needs to be at least one character long.

204.description: No Content. The organizer name has been updated successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/url/path-parameter-invalid
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax

put.description:
<!-- theme: warning -->

> This endpoint is deprecated, use [`PUT /organizers/{organizerId}/name/{language}`](/reference/entry.json/paths/~1organizers~1{organizerId}~1name~1{language}/put) instead.

Updates the name of the organizer with the given `organizerId`. The new name of the request body will be set on the organizer with default language `nl`. The new name needs to be at least one character long.

204.description: No Content. The organizer name has been updated successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

put.description:
<!-- theme: warning -->

> This endpoint is deprecated, use [`PUT /organizers/{organizerId}/address/{language}`](/reference/entry.json/paths/~1organizers~1{organizerId}~1address~1{language}/put) instead.


Updates the address of the organizer with the given `organizerId`. The new address of the request body will be set on the organizer in the default language `nl`.

An address consists of the following properties which are all required:
* streetAddress: the street name and street number
* postalCode: the postal code
* addressLocality: the town or city
* addressCountry: the 2-character country code

204.description: No Content. The organizer address has been updated successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

delete.description: Delete the address of the organizer with the given `organizerId`.

204.description: No Content. The organizer address has been deleted successfully.

put.description:
Updates the address of the organizer with the given `organizerId`. The new address of the request body will be set on the organizer in the given `language`.

An address consists of the following properties which are all required:
* streetAddress: the street name and street number
* postalCode: the postal code
* addressLocality: the town or city
* addressCountry: the 2-character country code

204.description: No Content. The organizer address has been updated successfully.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/url/path-parameter-invalid
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

schemaErrors.error: The required properties url is missing.

value.description: Picture of the last publiq event

requestBody.description: The image to add to an organizer.

post.description:
Add an image to an organizer.

The image objects contains the following properties:
* `id`: the id of the image which is required
* `language`: an optional language of the image and description
* `copyrightHolder`: the optional copyright holder of the image
* `description`: the description of the image which is also optional

<!-- theme: info -->
> The optional fields that are not provided will get the values from the properties of the orginally uploaded image.

204.description: The images were updated.

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

patch.description:
Update one or more images of an organizer.

The images to update are identified by their `id`. It is possible to update one or more of the following properties:

* The `language` of an image
* The `description` of an image
* The `copyrightHolder` of an image

Only images included in the `PATCH` request will be updated. Other images that also exist on the organizer will not be removed or updated.

204.description: The image was removed from the organizer.

delete.description: Remove an image from an organizer.

204.description: Main image was set

400.description:
Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-syntax
* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

schemaErrors.error: The required properties imageId is missing.

put.description:
Sets the main image of an organizer. This only requires the `imageId` of the image to set as main.

<!-- theme: info -->
> For backwards compatible reasons `mediaObjectId` is also supported.

requestBody.description: The image id of the new main image.

get.description:
Returns the details of all news articles matching the provided search. The search can be created based on a combination of 3 query parameters:
- `publisher`
- `about`
- `url`

Basic pagination is supported and the results are limited to 30 news articles.

The extra query parameter `page` can be used to get news articles after the first 30 results.

<!-- theme: info -->

> For backward compatibility with older API clients, this path is also available at `/news_articles`. However the preferred path is `/news-articles`.

hydra:member.headline: API reward for publiq
hydra:member.text: This year publiq won an API reward for it's innovative RESTful API

hydra:member.headline: madewithlove maakt een API
hydra:member.text: madewithlove maakt een RESTful API in samenwerking met publiq

value.text: This year publiq won an API reward for it's innovative RESTful API

Bad Request. Possible error types:

schemaErrors.error: The required property url is missing.

post.description:
Creates a news article.

<!-- theme: warning -->

> If a news article with the same `url` and `about` already exists, this request will result in a `400` error response to prevent duplicates. If you want to update the existing news article instead, find it programmatically using [`GET /news-articles`](reference/entry.json/paths/~1news-articles/get) with `url` and `about` query parameters, and send a [`PUT /news-articles/{articleId}`](/reference/entry.json/paths/~1news-articles~1{articleId}/put) request instead.

<!-- theme: info -->

> For backward compatibility with older API clients, this path is also available at `/news_articles`. However the preferred path is `/news-articles`.

get.description:
Returns the details of a news article with the given article id.

<!-- theme: info -->

> For backward compatibility with older API clients, this path is also available at `/news_articles/{articleId}`. However the preferred path is `/news-articles/{articleId}`.

value.headline: API reward for publiq
value.text: This year publiq won an API reward for it's innovative RESTful API

value.headline: API reward for publiq
value.text: This year publiq won an API reward for it's innovative RESTful API

delete.description:
Delete a news article with the given article id.

<!-- theme: info -->

> For backward compatibility with older API clients, this path is also available at `/news_articles/{articleId}`. However the preferred path is `/news-articles/{articleId}`.

Bad Request. Possible error types:

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/missing

* https://api.publiq.be/probs/body/invalid-data

schemaErrors.error: The required property url is missing.

put.description:
Updates an existing news article.

<!-- theme: info -->

> For backward compatibility with older API clients, this path is also available at `/news_articles/{articleId}`. However the preferred path is `/news-articles/{articleId}`.

USER_ACCESS_TOKEN.description: A user access token, obtained by redirecting the end user to publiq's authorization server to login. See the [authentication docs about user access tokens](https://publiq.stoplight.io/docs/authentication/docs/user-access-token.md) for more info.

CLIENT_ACCESS_TOKEN.description: A client access token, obtained by exchanging your client id and client secret for a token via an HTTP request to publiq's authorization server. See the [authentication docs about client access tokens](https://publiq.stoplight.io/docs/authentication/docs/client-access-token.md) for more info.

eventId.name: eventId
eventId.description: Unique id of an event, in the format of a UUID

placeId.name: placeId
placeId.description: Unique id of an place, in the format of a UUID

organizerId.name: organizerId
organizerId.description: Unique id of an organizer, in the format of a UUID

articleId.name: articleId
articleId.description: Unique id of a news article, in the format of a UUID

language.name: language

labelName.name: labelName
labelName.description: The label to add to an event, place or organizer. The label name should be longer than 1 character but shorter than 255 characters. The label name should not contain semicolons.

videoId.name: videoId

termId.name: termId
termId.description: Unique id of a taxonomy term. Taxonomy terms are pre-defined and can be found using our [Terms](./docs/terms.md) guide

imageId.name: imageId
imageId.description: The unique uuid of an already uploaded image.

Unauthorized.description:
Unauthorized. Your request is missing the required credentials to authenticate. See the Authentication documentation for more info.

* type: https://api.publiq.be/probs/auth/unauthorized
* detail: might contain a developer-readable explanation of the reason

Forbidden.description:
Forbidden. Your request was successfully authenticated but you do not have permission to perform this particular request.

* type: https://api.publiq.be/probs/auth/forbidden
* detail: might contain a developer-readable explanation of the reason
